items.title: Australia rings in 2026 with sombre commemoration, rainy fireworks
items.description: A minute of silence for the 15 killed at Bondi ended with a message of peace before Sydney's world-famous fireworks display.

items.title: Trump's midterms, Xi's signals: What to watch in 2026
items.description: Disruptions to the world trade system courtesy of Donald Trump and a reshaping of historic alliances as multiple wars drag on have set the stage for a precarious year in global affairs.

items.title: Planning to travel overseas in 2026? These law changes might affect you
items.description: From currency changes to cleaner toilets, here's what is changing around the world in the new year.

items.title: Two drown, man and teenage boy missing in multiple coastal emergencies off Sydney
items.description: A man and woman have died and two people are missing following three separate incidents on Sydney waters in the past 24 hours.

items.title: From no fireworks in Hong Kong to a party record: How the world celebrated
items.description: People around the world see in the start of a new year and say goodbye to a sometimes challenging 2025.

items.title: Case file of last woman hanged in Australia released after 75 years
items.description: Jean Lee and her two co-accused were executed for murder in 1950. Handwritten letters from the trio are among items publicly available for the first time since their trial captured the nation's attention.

items.title: Australian soldier fighting for Ukraine 'killed week before wedding'
items.description: Russell Allan Wilson, who spent several years fighting for Ukraine, has been remembered as someone who "gave his life so others could keep theirs".

items.title: US attacks 'narco-trafficking' boats in international waters
items.description: US military forces have carried out strikes against three boats in international waters in the Pacific Ocean. Eight people are reported to have survived.

items.title: 'Simply unprecedented': Israel banning dozens of charities from Gaza
items.description: The Israeli government says the organisations have not met new requirements, which include recognising Israel as a Jewish and democratic state and banning any so-called "de-legitimisation" of Israel.

items.title: Bushfire east of Perth Airport sparks emergency warning
items.description: A bushfire is threatening lives and homes in parts of Maida Vale, Kalamunda and Forrestfield in Perth's east, with an emergency warning issued for the blaze.

items.title: Efforts to mitigate 'homegrown' extremism revealed in cabinet documents
items.description: From expectations of a trade union backlash against controversial industrial relations reform, to concerns about "homegrown" extremism in Australia, here are what previously unseen cabinet documents tell us about Australian politics in 2005.

items.title: Stranded travellers welcome new year in the bush as floods cut roads
items.description: Outback towns remain cut off, and floodwaters are expected to linger in the north-west for weeks. Graziers have started to assess their properties and count stock losses.

items.title: 'Didn't know what was happening': Gold Coast woman recounts Peru train crash
items.description: Jo Needham was halfway through a "bucket list" trip across South America when she was flung from her seat on a train near the ancient tourist site of Machu Picchu.

items.title: Stripping away misconceptions and fighting for nude beaches
items.description: Half a century after the first nude beach opened in Australia, these naturists say they are still fighting to keep beaches open and misconceptions at bay.

items.title: Drug warning as revellers head to NYD Sydney music festival
items.description: A pill testing trial has been expanded to Sydney's Field Day music festival, but authorities are urging partygoers not to be complacent.

items.title: Scientists rush to protect rare Australian fish species
items.description: The Bloomfield River cod, found in a far north Queensland river catchment, is the world's only tropical freshwater cod, and scientists are working to have it officially protected amid threats from the climate and introduced species.

items.title: Lorin recorded her father's story on tape. This is why you should too
items.description: When Lorin Clarke asked her father, satirist John Clarke, if she could start recording their conversations, she thought it would just be for them. But when he tragically died aged 68, one year after the recordings began, Lorin felt his story belonged to more than just her.

items.title: How running helped Shalom overcome years of substance abuse
items.description: Shalom Kaa used to think running was something other people did. But after a series of events that left him at his lowest, running became a big part of his recovery following years of substance abuse with crystal methamphetamines.

items.title: Police involved as Roar and Mariners clash at half-time of A-League game
items.description: The send-off of Brisbane Roar coach Michael Valkanis is the catalyst for a confrontation in the tunnel at Gosford Stadium, with Mariners coach Warren Moon calling it "a disgrace" and "an embarrassment".

items.title: Police investigate Melbourne NYE double stabbing
items.description: Two men were taken to hospital with serious injuries after being stabbed in Carlton shortly before midnight.

items.title: Man charged with making threatening phone call to Melbourne journalist
items.description: Investigators from a taskforce targeting crime in the construction industry say a 31-year-old man threatened journalist Nick McKenzie in a Christmas Eve call.

items.title: Police find explosives, arrest two people in Bendigo suburb
items.description: A man and a woman will face court charged with numerous offences, including manufacturing unauthorised explosive devices.

items.title: Four stinky corpse flowers to bloom in a week at Queensland botanic gardens
items.description: Renowned for their size and stench, blooming corpse flowers are a rare occurrence. But to have four flowering in a week is "something of a record".

items.title: Lynn's fireworks get Strikers over the line in NYE clash for first time since 2018
items.description: Former Brisbane star Chris Lynn clobbers the Adelaide Strikers to an easy victory over the Heat in the New Year's Eve Big Bash League clash.

items.title: WA commercial fishers face uncertain future as demersal fishing ban begins
items.description: From today, commercial demersal fishing is banned along hundreds of kilometres of the WA coastline in an effort to recover fish species numbers.
